newsitem.title: FRANCE: French, German views broadly similar - Chirac.
newsitem.headline: French, German views broadly similar - Chirac.

text.p: France and Germany share broadly similar views on Europe and are confident of bridging any differences on a budget pact in time for a European Union summit in Amsterdam next week, French President Jacques Chirac said after a Franco-German summit on Friday.

"We discussed...the problems raised by social issues which complement the economic aspects of the (European Union) stability and growth pact, and there is every reason to believe there will be a solution in Amsterdam," Chirac said after the one-day talks with German chancellor Helmut Kohl.
"We observed that our views are very largely similar and wherever this is not the case a solution can easily be found."
He added that he and Kohl had also discussed preparations for a new EU intergovernmental treaty and bilateral issues.
